text: Retinoic acid activates <extra_id_0> interferon regulatory factor-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression in myeloid cells .
All-trans-retinoic acid ( ATRA ) is the drug of choice in the treatment of acute promyelocytic leukemia ( APL ) .
ATRA induces both in vitro and in vivo differentiation of APL cells into mature granulocytes .
However , the molecular mechanisms involved in ATRA - dependent growth inhibition and cellular differentiation are not presently understood .
The NB4 cell line , which is derived from the bone marrow of a patient with APL during relapse , can be used as a model system to study the growth and differentiation of APL cells .

Because interferon ( IFN ) regulatory factors ( <extra_id_0> IRF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IRF-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) and other IFN - inducible gene products regulate cell growth , we analyzed the effects of ATRA on the expression of these genes .

We show that ATRA directly activates <extra_id_0> IRF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression , followed by activation of <extra_id_0> IRF-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and 2'-5 ' oligoadenylate synthetase ( OAS ) gene expression with slower kinetics .

In addition to NB4 cells , ATRA also activated <extra_id_0> IRF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression in HL-60 , U937 , and THP-1 cells , which all respond to ATRA by growth inhibition .
A more than additive increase in <extra_id_0> IRF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression was seen with ATRA and <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in NB4 cells .

ATRA did not activate nuclear factor kappa B or signal transducer and activator of transcription ( STAT ) activation pathways , suggesting that an alternate mechanism is involved in <extra_id_0> IRF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene activation .

The ATRA - induced expression of <extra_id_0> IRF-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , an activator of transcription and repressor of transformation , may be one of the molecular mechanisms of ATRA - induced growth inhibition , and the basis for the synergistic actions of ATRA and IFNs in myeloid leukemia cells .
